name: Js-excel-heatmap
body:
### Welcome to JS Excel Heatmap.
This simple library tries to mimic the excel heatmap feature :

It basically add background color to a data table to give an easy understanding of data displayed in the table.


### To contribute to the project

Clone the project.
```
$ git clone https://github.com/username/js-excel-heatmap.git
$ cd js-excel-heatmap
# make changes
$ git commit -a -m "Your commit"
$ git push
```

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.

### Examples usage
It's easy to get started using Js-ExcelHeatmap library.
Code examples coming soon


### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor's GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with this library. Contact @diokey, or post your questions on [Stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
